txt.en: 'Listen, and I will speak of his arrival: Rûkhor… the Pale Herald.'
'You seek her? Why?'
'What is this? Such strength!'
'Listen, and I will speak of his arrival: Rûkhor… the Pale Herald.'
'I come in peace, Ungoladan. We have a common goal.'
'I have come to speak with your matriarch. Stand aside.'
'Hard to believe, outsider. Do not test my patience.'
'Power.'
'I believe you are searching for the one you call Mam Murgwid.
Instance: The Pale Herald
'I seek her as well.'
'What do you want, outsider? Why should we not devour all of you where you stand?'
'Aid me, and I will give you more. Much more.'
Talk to Felgúr
Listen to Felgúr's story
'They were seduced by his gift, but I do not trust the dark man.'
TBD
Felgúr has a tale to tell about a dark man who came to lead his people astray.
'We call her Ungwetári. Shelob. The Queen of Spiders.'
'A gift? What can you offer us, Pale Herald?'
'I seek to... pledge myself to Her Ladyship. She is the true heir of Mordor.'
Felgúr has a tale to tell about a dark man who came to lead his people astray.
Felgúr has a tale to tell about a dark man who came to lead his people astray.
'Despite the trance caused by Mam Murgwid's call, they listened! They could sense his aura of power.'
'I am Rûkhor, the Pale Herald. This land is my domain, bequeathed by Lord Sauron himself.'
'So excited they were to hear that others knew of Mam Murgwid! So excited they abandoned their senses!'
'Do you understand? The dark man cannot be trusted! He will lead the Ungoledain to death and dishonour.'
'If you assist me, I will allow you to pass through my lands unmolested. I also offer a gift.'
'His blood magic is foul, it reeks of death! This is not our way!'
